com.github.btrekkie.reductions.mario

Class MarioGadget

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.btrekkie.reductions.mario.MarioGadget
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPlanarGadget
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MarioBarrierGadget, MarioClauseGadget, MarioCrossoverGadget, MarioFinishGadget, MarioHorizontalWireGadget, MarioJunctionGadget, MarioStartGadget, MarioTurnWireGadget, MarioVariableGadget, MarioVerticalWireGadget

    public abstract class MarioGadget
extends java.lang.Object
implements IPlanarGadget
    A gadget in a MarioProblem. If the contents of a MarioTile leaks into other cells, as with MarioTile.CASTLE, then the cells MarioTile must be in the same gadget as the cells into which the contents leak.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MarioGadget() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int height()
      Returns the height of the gadget.
      abstract MarioTile[][] tiles()
      Returns the tiles that comprise the gadget, so that tiles()[y][x] is the tile whose top-left corner is at (x, y) relative to the top-left corner of the gadget.
      MarioTile[][] tiles(int minX, int minY, int width, int height)
      Returns the tiles that comprise the specified rectangular region of the gadget, so that tiles[y][x] is the tile whose top-left corner is at (minX + x, minY + y) relative to the top-left corner of the gadget, where "tiles" is the return value.
      int width()
      Returns the width of the gadget.

    • Method Detail

      • tiles

        public abstract MarioTile[][] tiles()
        Returns the tiles that comprise the gadget, so that tiles()[y][x] is the tile whose top-left corner is at (x, y) relative to the top-left corner of the gadget.

      • width

        public int width()
        Returns the width of the gadget. This must be positive. The default implementation obtains the width from the return value of tiles().
        Specified by:
        width in interface IPlanarGadget

      • height

        public int height()
        Returns the height of the gadget. This must be positive. The default implementation obtains the height from the return value of tiles().
        Specified by:
        height in interface IPlanarGadget

      • tiles

        public MarioTile[][] tiles(int minX,
                           int minY,
                           int width,
                           int height)
        Returns the tiles that comprise the specified rectangular region of the gadget, so that tiles[y][x] is the tile whose top-left corner is at (minX + x, minY + y) relative to the top-left corner of the gadget, where "tiles" is the return value. The rectangle must be a subrectangle of this gadget. "width" and "height" must be positive. The default implementation obtains the tiles from the return value of tiles().
        Parameters:
        minX - The x coordinate of the left edge of the rectangle, relative to the top-left corner of the gadget.
        minY - The y coordinate of the top edge of the rectangle, relative to the top-left corner of the gadget.
        width - The width of the rectangle.
        height - The height of the rectangle.
        Returns:
        The tiles.
